Given that drcsim 2.0 is set to be released soon and the last polaris model update mainly added textures (very nice ones though! ;) ) and simplified collision models I figured I'll point out the existing scale issues with the current version before it's too late:

The outer dimensions seem to be correct (it's exactly 10cm too high according to the specs on the website but maybe polaris measured the real model with suspension system), but the distance between seat and steering wheel is way too small (only about 15cm, see [1] and [2]) and the seat might be too high as the robot can't even reach down to the pedals even when sitting at the edge of the seat (see [3]) even though it has the leg length of an average sized human.

When looking at [4] and [5] and the video in [6] you can see that for a normal person sitting in the ranger there is still plenty free space between their legs and the steering wheel and the pedals are easy to reach while sitting using just the lower leg + foot. Clearly this is currently not the case as you can see in [1], [2], and [3].

A fix to issue #103 should be included in 2.0 as well in order to be able to drive the model properly.

When looking at [4] and [5] and the video in [6] you can see that for a normal person sitting in the ranger there is still plenty free space between their legs and the steering wheel and the pedals are easy to reach while sitting using just the lower leg + foot.
